sources.title: Doll Face
sources.description: A former burlesque queen needs to acquire some culture to give herself some legitimacy.

sources.title: Doll Face (1945) Burlesque Comedy, Music, Romance Film
sources.description:
HUBBA, HUBBA, HUBBA! WHAT A MUSICAL! Burlesque star (Blaine) makes it in the big time.
 
Director: Lewis Seiler
Writers: Gypsy Rose Lee (as Louise Hovick), Leonard Praskins 
Stars: Vivian Blaine, Dennis O'Keefe, Perry Como & Carmen Miranda
Genres: Burlesque, Comedy, Music, Romance

@CCC socials:
https://www.facebook.com/CultCinemaClassics 
https://www.instagram.com/cultcinemaclassics
https://www.twitch.tv/cultcinemaclassics

metadata.Plot: Burlesque queen Doll Face Carroll is dismissed from an audition for a legitimate Broadway show because she's considered unrefined. Her boss/manager, Mike, decides that she can acquire some polish and also get plenty of publicity by writing her autobiography; he hires a ghost writer to do all the work but doesn't consider that Doll Face and her collaborator might have more than a book on their minds.
metadata.Writer: Gypsy Rose Lee, Leonard Praskins, Harold Buchman
metadata.Actors: Vivian Blaine, Dennis O'Keefe, Perry Como
